instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H? This is the input from the USB-C charger or the battery that is the input voltage for the chip responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H. It can be missing when capacitors on this line are shorted to ground, or when the diode in front of it leading to the chip that creates PP3V3_G3H is blown. .
definitions.PP5V_S5_LDO: What is PP5V_S5_LDO? PP5V_S5_LDO is a 5v rail present when the machine is in a S5 soft off state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> Unstable/Pulsing
threads.message:
Have yet another board with no power. 20V present but no current draw. Notice <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> is unstable and pulsing.

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> - 0.0
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5_LDO</SIGNAL> - 5.03
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V3G3H</SIGNAL> - 12.3 and stable 
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P5VG3S</SIGNAL> - 12.3 and stable 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> - 3.3 and stable


<SIGNAL>P5VG3S_EN_DLY</SIGNAL> - pulses also

Any suggestions on this one.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> Unstable/Pulsing
threads.message:
Any history available?
SSD voltages present?
Did you try DFU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> Unstable/Pulsing
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> - 0.0

The board does look like it had been cleaned in the past but i can't find any corroded components. 

Yes, i did try DFU and it failed with an error.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> Unstable/Pulsing
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on big coils
Also check at SSD power rails...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: <SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> Unstable/Pulsing
threads.message: what page is the ssd power rail for this model
